headline: Paul Gosar Blames ‘Miscommunication’ With Staffer For His Address to White Nationalist Nick Fuentes’ AFPAC
author: Kipp Jones
sentences:
“And there was miscommunication.”
Gosar spoke to AFPAC in-person in 2021:
Rep. Paul Gosar is helping Nick Fuentes recruit young conservatives to his white nationalist, Christian nationalist ideology https://t.co/1yZuAV3oq4 pic.twitter.com/8rzfAhSv5S
— Right Wing Watch (@RightWingWatch) March 12, 2021
When asked about addressing the White nationalists again this year, Gosar reportedly shrugged it off.

He blamed the appearance on a staffer:
“It wasn’t supposed to go to Nick’s group,” Gosar told POLITICO, noting that a staffer “misconstrued” directions from his chief of staff.
“The young people that were being misled by somebody — we should be trying to mentor, trying to change them,” he told POLITICO.
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) had said he would speak to Gosar and Greene about the appearances at AFPAC.
Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ) blamed his video appearance at a White nationalist conference a month ago on his staff.
Gosar appeared at the America First Political Action Committee, as did Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA).
Gosar concluded he and Greene “didn’t know anything about” Fuentes or his group prior to addressing AFPAC.
Fuentes is an ardent Holocaust denier and has made anti-Semitic statements for years.
The tape was intended to go to other groups as a general “welcome video,” he added.
The event was hosted by Nick Fuentes, and was an extreme right alternative to CPAC.
POLITICO spoke with Gosar about a video statement he made addressing AFPAC.
He also said AFPAC was not among groups “authorized” to receive his video.
The United States is at a crisis point,’” Gosar told the outlet.

Nick’s got a problem with his mouth.”
Have a tip we should know?
“So there is nothing there,” he said he explained to McCarthy.
The video “just basically said ‘welcome to the Miami area.
Gosar said he sent a copy of the video to McCarthy.
“I’ve given up … on dealing with Nick.
“We’re kind of short-handed,” he said.
Have a great conference.
tips@mediaite.com
